title: Calculate the EV/EBITDA and EV/Revenue metrics for Qualcomm (QCOM) in FY 2025. Use the shares outstanding and share price at close from Sep 28, 2025 for the EV calculation. Express the answer using two decimal points of rounding.
description:
1. Calculate the Enterprise Value using EV = market capitalization + total debt - cash and cash equivalents 
 
 2. Extract common shares outstanding = 1,074M, short-term debt = $0M, long-term debt = $14,811M, total debt = $14,811M, and cash and cash equivalents = $5,520M 
 
 3. Add short-term and long-term debt to get total debt = $14,811M 
 
 4. Calculate market capitalization = $169.2 * 1074 = $181,720.8M 
 
 5. Use the formula to calculate EV = $191,011.8M ($181,720.8 + $14,811 - $5,520) 
 
 6. Calculate EBITDA using EBITDA = net income + interest + tax + depreciation & amortization - investment and other income
 
 7. Extract net income = $5,541M, interest = $664M, tax = $7,122, depreciation and amortization = $1,602M, investment and other income = $972M. Use the formula in step 7 to calculate EBITDA = $13,957M. 
 
 8. Calculate EV/EBITDA = $191,011.8M/$13,957M = 13.69x 
 
 9. From the 10-K Filing: Extract revenue = $44,284 
 
 10. Calculate EV/Revenue = $191,011.8M/$44,284M = 4.31x

rubric.criteria: Include Common shares outstanding = 1,074M as input
Include Share price used = $169.2 as input
Include Cash and cash equivalents = $5,520M as input
Subtract Investment and other income = $972M as input
Round EV/EBITDA to two decimal points = 13.69x
Round EV/Revenue to two decimal points = 4.31x
